key_mistakes.reason: Developing the bishop to an ineffective square, missing the opportunity to support the center.
Exposing the knight to unnecessary danger without a concrete plan.
Allows the opponent to gain tempo and control the center.
Blunder due to miscalculation, losing material.
Blunder leading to losing control over the position.
Moving the king away from the center unnecessarily.
Advancing the pawn too early, losing control of the center.

recommendations: Focus on maintaining central control throughout the game.
Avoid unnecessary pawn moves that weaken your structure.
Ensure effective development of all pieces before launching attacks.
In endgames, prioritize king activity and pawn promotion potential.
